questions.question: Which country does the beneficiary applying from?
questions.suggestedAnswer: The beneficiary is currently applying from {{beneficiary_country}}.
questions.guidance: Provide the country where the beneficiary resides currently.
questions.tooltip: Officers need to know the applicant's current location to determine consulate jurisdiction and visa processing rules.

questions.question: What is your date of marriage?
questions.guidance: Provide the official date as per your marriage certificate.
questions.tooltip: Officers verify the marriage date to ensure consistency with other submitted documents.

questions.question: Where did the marriage take place (city & country)?
questions.suggestedAnswer: The marriage took place in {{marriage_location}}, and it was conducted according to our cultural and legal practices.
questions.guidance: Provide the full city and country.
questions.tooltip: Officers check the marriage location for authenticity and eligibility purposes.

questions.question: How and where did you first meet your spouse?
questions.suggestedAnswer: We first met {{meeting_place}}, and our connection developed naturally over time. We started communicating regularly and learned more about each other’s values and goals.
questions.guidance: Focus on how the relationship developed naturally.
questions.tooltip: Officers assess whether the relationship started naturally and is genuine.

questions.question: When and where did you first meet in person?
questions.suggestedAnswer: We first met in person at {{first_meeting_place}} on {{first_meeting_date}}, which helped strengthen our bond.
questions.guidance: Provide approximate details; exact dates are helpful but not critical.
questions.tooltip: Officers want to confirm the timeline of your relationship.

questions.question: How many times have you met in person?
questions.suggestedAnswer: We have met in person {{number_of_visits}} times, maintaining consistent communication between visits.
questions.guidance: Be honest and approximate if unsure.
questions.tooltip: Officers gauge the seriousness and commitment in the relationship.

questions.question: How and when did the proposal happen?
questions.suggestedAnswer: The proposal happened on {{proposal_date}} and was meaningful to both of us, reflecting our commitment to each other.
questions.tooltip: Officers want to see genuine relationship milestones.

questions.question: Why did you decide to get married?
questions.suggestedAnswer: We decided to get married because we share long-term goals, mutual support, and a vision for building a life together as a family.
questions.tooltip: Officers assess whether the marriage is based on genuine intent, not for visa purposes.

questions.question: Tell me about your wedding.
questions.suggestedAnswer: Our wedding was celebrated with close family and friends in {{wedding_location}}. It reflected our culture, values, and the significance of bringing our families together.
questions.guidance: Size of wedding does not matter.
questions.tooltip: Officers may ask about your wedding to verify cultural and social integration.

questions.question: Have you met your spouse’s family?
questions.suggestedAnswer: Yes, I have met my spouse’s family and maintain regular contact with them. This helped strengthen our relationship and integration into each other’s family.
questions.tooltip: Officers check family integration as part of relationship genuineness.

questions.question: How do you communicate when you are apart?
questions.suggestedAnswer: We communicate regularly through {{communication_methods}}, ensuring we stay connected and share updates about our daily lives.
questions.tooltip: Officers want to know how the couple maintains a real connection despite distance.

questions.question: What do you do together as a couple?
questions.suggestedAnswer: We enjoy activities like {{shared_activities}} together, supporting each other’s routines and planning for our future.
questions.tooltip: Officers assess shared lifestyle and compatibility.

questions.question: Do you share finances?
questions.suggestedAnswer: We manage finances together as a household, making joint decisions and supporting each other financially where needed.
questions.guidance: Separate accounts are fine; highlight responsibility.
questions.tooltip: Officers check financial interdependency as a sign of genuine relationship.

questions.question: Where does your spouse work?
questions.suggestedAnswer: My spouse works at {{spouse_employer}} and maintains stable employment, which helps us plan responsibly for our shared future.
questions.guidance: Do not guess salary unless asked.
questions.tooltip: Officers want to verify employment stability and financial responsibility.

questions.question: Where will you live in the United States?
questions.suggestedAnswer: We plan to live together in {{intended_us_state}}, building a stable home while pursuing professional and personal growth.
questions.tooltip: Officers check that living plans are realistic and consistent with application.

questions.question: Do you plan to work or study in the US?
questions.suggestedAnswer: Once authorized, I plan to contribute responsibly via work or study while prioritizing our family’s stability.
questions.tooltip: Officers want to know intentions post-immigration.

questions.question: Have you ever been refused a US visa?
questions.suggestedAnswer: If applicable, I disclosed any visa refusals honestly and provided the circumstances in my application.
questions.tooltip: Officers check past visa history for compliance and honesty.

questions.question: Do you plan to have children?
questions.suggestedAnswer: We have discussed our future family plans and are open to children based on our responsibilities and circumstances.
questions.tooltip: Officers want to understand family planning and intentions.

questions.question: What holidays do you celebrate together?
questions.suggestedAnswer: We celebrate important holidays together and respect each other’s cultural traditions, blending them in our family life.
questions.tooltip: Officers check cultural integration and mutual respect.
